page.title: 10Service areas
page.content: The area is almost entirely based on farming &the population is scattered. The population looks to various centres for their services.The most frequent goods are foods which must be bought locally,eg Cirencester.Some farmers used Cheltenham because the area is half way between the two on the A435. The Post Ofice and doctor need to be close ie Chedworth,Rendcomb & N Cerney in village centres.Less important & less frequently needed are clothes & furniture.This can almost be a day trip to Cheltenham.This is a favourite choice giving a wider variety of products than Cirencester or local villages.London was also supported for items such as TVs,cars,fridges etc. The service areas for trade in farming products can be more widely spread to include the Midlands,the London area or the of the UK.
